CRESCENT: The figure of the moon as it appears in its first or last quarter, with concave and convex edges terminating in points.
FULL: Containing the maximum possible amount that can fit in the space available.
WANING: To progressively lose its splendor, value, ardor, power, intensity etc.; to decline.
WAXING: To apply wax to (something, such as a shoe, a floor, a car, or an apple), usually to make it shiny.
